lootbox_items.dot_point: Investigate and apply theoretically and practically Newton's three laws of motion in situations where two or more coplanar forces act along a straight line and in two dimensions
lootbox_items.notes: Foundation of dynamics - relates force, mass, and acceleration

lootbox_items.dot_point: Investigate and analyse theoretically and practically the uniform circular motion of an object moving in a horizontal plane
lootbox_items.notes: Centripetal acceleration always points toward center

lootbox_items.dot_point: Vehicle moving around a circular road
lootbox_items.notes: Friction provides centripetal force for horizontal circular motion

lootbox_items.dot_point: Vehicle moving around a banked track
lootbox_items.notes: Banking allows higher speeds without relying on friction

lootbox_items.dot_point: Object on the end of a string
Model natural and artificial satellite motion as uniform circular motion
lootbox_items.notes: Gravitational force provides centripetal force for orbits

lootbox_items.dot_point: Investigate and apply theoretically Newton's second law to circular motion in a vertical plane (forces at highest and lowest positions only)
Investigate and analyse theoretically and practically the motion of projectiles near Earth's surface, including qualitative description of air resistance effects
lootbox_items.notes: Horizontal and vertical motions are independent

lootbox_items.dot_point: Investigate and apply theoretically and practically the laws of energy and momentum conservation in isolated systems in one dimension
lootbox_items.notes: Momentum always conserved in isolated systems

lootbox_items.dot_point: Investigate and analyse theoretically and practically impulse in an isolated system for collisions between objects moving in a straight line
Work done = force × displacement
lootbox_items.notes: Work is scalar, can be positive or negative

lootbox_items.dot_point: Work done = area under force vs distance graph
Analyse transformations between kinetic, elastic potential, gravitational potential energy and energy dissipated
lootbox_items.notes: Energy conserved but may change forms

lootbox_items.dot_point: Kinetic energy at low speeds including elastic and inelastic collisions
lootbox_items.notes: KE conserved in elastic, not in inelastic collisions

lootbox_items.dot_point: Elastic potential energy including ideal springs obeying Hooke's Law
lootbox_items.notes: Energy stored in deformed elastic materials

lootbox_items.dot_point: Gravitational potential energy near Earth's surface
lootbox_items.notes: Valid for small height changes near Earth's surface

lootbox_items.dot_point: Describe gravitation, magnetism and electricity using a field model
lootbox_items.notes: Fields explain action at a distance

lootbox_items.dot_point: Investigate and compare gravitational, magnetic and electric fields including directions, shapes, attractive/repulsive effects
lootbox_items.notes: Gravity always attractive, E and B can attract or repel

lootbox_items.dot_point: Compare gravitational and electrical fields about a point mass or charge
Direction of gravitational and electric fields
lootbox_items.notes: g points toward mass, E points away from + charge

lootbox_items.dot_point: Shape of gravitational and electric fields
Use of inverse square law to determine field magnitude
lootbox_items.notes: Field strength decreases with square of distance

lootbox_items.dot_point: Potential energy changes associated with point mass or charge moving in field
lootbox_items.notes: Work done against field increases PE

lootbox_items.dot_point: Apply field model to magnetic phenomena including bar magnets and current-carrying wires, loops, solenoids
lootbox_items.notes: Current creates magnetic field, follows right-hand rule

lootbox_items.dot_point: Identify fields as static or changing, uniform or non-uniform
lootbox_items.notes: Uniform fields have parallel, equally spaced field lines

lootbox_items.dot_point: Analyse use of electric field to accelerate a charge
lootbox_items.notes: Charged particles accelerate in electric fields

lootbox_items.dot_point: Potential energy changes in uniform electric field
Magnitude of force on charged particle in uniform electric field
Use of magnetic field to change path of charged particle
Magnitude and direction of force on electron beam by magnetic field
Radius of path followed by electron in magnetic field
lootbox_items.notes: Circular motion when v perpendicular to B

lootbox_items.dot_point: Use of gravitational fields to accelerate mass
lootbox_items.notes: Free fall acceleration in gravitational field

lootbox_items.dot_point: Gravitational field and force concepts
lootbox_items.notes: Field strength independent of test mass

lootbox_items.dot_point: Potential energy changes in uniform gravitational field
Analyse change in gravitational PE from force-distance and field-distance graphs
equations: ΔE_p = m × Area under g-r graph

lootbox_items.dot_point: Apply concepts of gravitational force and normal force to satellites in orbit
lootbox_items.notes: No normal force in orbit - only gravity

lootbox_items.dot_point: Model satellite motion as uniform circular orbital motion
Describe interaction of two fields - charges/poles can attract or repel, masses only attract
lootbox_items.notes: Fundamental difference between gravity and E/M fields

lootbox_items.dot_point: Force on current-carrying conductor in external magnetic field
Operation of simple DC motors with coil, loops, uniform B-field, split-ring commutator
lootbox_items.notes: Commutator reverses current every half turn

lootbox_items.dot_point: Effect of current, B-field, number of loops on motor torque
lootbox_items.notes: All factors directly proportional to torque

lootbox_items.dot_point: Model particle acceleration in accelerators/synchrotrons as uniform circular motion
lootbox_items.notes: E-field for linear acceleration, B-field for direction change

lootbox_items.dot_point: Calculate magnetic flux when B-field perpendicular to area
lootbox_items.notes: Maximum flux when B perpendicular to area

lootbox_items.dot_point: Investigate generation of EMF including AC voltage
lootbox_items.notes: Faraday's Law - changing flux induces EMF

lootbox_items.dot_point: Rate of change of magnetic flux effect on EMF
Number of loops effect on induced EMF
lootbox_items.notes: EMF proportional to number of turns

lootbox_items.dot_point: Direction of induced EMF in coil
lootbox_items.notes: Lenz's Law - opposes change causing it

lootbox_items.dot_point: Production of DC in generators vs AC in alternators using commutators and slip rings
lootbox_items.notes: Commutator for DC, slip rings for AC

lootbox_items.dot_point: Production of electricity using photovoltaic cells and need for inverter
lootbox_items.notes: PV cells produce DC, inverter converts to AC

lootbox_items.dot_point: Compare sinusoidal AC voltages - frequency, period, amplitude, peak-to-peak
Compare RMS voltage to DC voltage for same power
lootbox_items.notes: RMS gives equivalent DC heating effect

lootbox_items.dot_point: Analyse transformer action with electromagnetic induction
Analyse power supply considering transmission losses
lootbox_items.notes: High voltage reduces current and losses

lootbox_items.dot_point: Describe light as transverse electromagnetic wave produced by accelerating charges
lootbox_items.notes: E and B fields perpendicular to each other and direction

lootbox_items.dot_point: All electromagnetic waves travel at same speed c in vacuum
Formation of standing wave from traveling wave and its reflection
Analyse formation of standing waves with nodes at both ends
Investigate diffraction as directional spread with different gap/obstacle size
Explain Young's double slit experiment as evidence for wave nature of light
Constructive and destructive interference - path differences nλ and (n+½)λ
lootbox_items.notes: In phase vs out of phase addition

lootbox_items.dot_point: Effect of wavelength, screen distance, slit separation on interference patterns
Apply quantised energy of photons
Analyse photoelectric effect as evidence for particle nature of light
Experimental data - photocurrent vs potential, KE vs frequency graphs
Kinetic energy of emitted photoelectrons
Effects of intensity on photoelectron emission
lootbox_items.notes: Intensity affects number not energy of photoelectrons

lootbox_items.dot_point: Limitation of wave model in explaining photoelectric effect
lootbox_items.notes: Wave model predicts gradual energy accumulation

lootbox_items.dot_point: Interpret electron diffraction patterns as evidence for wave nature of matter
Distinguish between diffraction patterns produced by photons and electrons
Calculate de Broglie wavelength of matter
lootbox_items.notes: Matter waves - all particles have wavelength

lootbox_items.dot_point: Importance of quantisation in understanding light and atoms
Compare momentum of photons and matter of same wavelength
Explain production of atomic absorption and emission line spectra
Interpret spectra and calculate energy of absorbed/emitted photons
lootbox_items.notes: Each line corresponds to specific transition

lootbox_items.dot_point: Analyse photon emission/absorption as electron energy state changes
Single photon and electron double slit experiments as evidence for dual nature
lootbox_items.notes: Single particles create interference over time

lootbox_items.dot_point: Limitation of classical mechanics at speeds approaching c
lootbox_items.notes: Newton's laws fail at high speeds

lootbox_items.dot_point: Einstein's first postulate - laws of physics same in all inertial frames
Einstein's second postulate - speed of light constant for all observers
lootbox_items.notes: Independent of source or observer motion

lootbox_items.dot_point: Interpret null result of Michelson-Morley experiment
Compare Einstein's special relativity with classical physics
Describe proper time as time between events at same location
Describe proper length as length measured in rest frame
Model time dilation mathematically
Model length contraction mathematically
lootbox_items.notes: Length contracts in direction of motion

lootbox_items.dot_point: Explain muons reaching Earth using time dilation
lootbox_items.notes: Time dilation allows muons to survive journey

lootbox_items.dot_point: Particle accelerator lengths accounting for special relativity
GPS satellite time corrections for special relativity
Interpret Einstein's mass-energy relationship
Apply E=mc² to Sun, positron-electron annihilation, nuclear transformations
lootbox_items.notes: Nuclear reactions convert mass to energy

lootbox_items.dot_point: Identify physics concepts specific to investigation and explain significance
Explain characteristics of selected scientific methodology
Apply techniques of primary qualitative and quantitative data generation
Apply concepts of accuracy, precision, repeatability, reproducibility, resolution, validity
Identify and apply health, safety and ethical guidelines
Discuss nature of evidence supporting or refuting hypothesis
Apply methods of organizing, analyzing, evaluating primary data
Model scientific practice using logbook for primary data
Apply conventions of scientific poster presentation
Explain key findings and implications of investigation
